title: The Simplest Math Problem No One Can Solve - Collatz Conjecture
description: The Collatz Conjecture is the simplest math problem no one can solve — it's easy enough for almost anyone to understand but nobody has been able to prove it.

title: How Electricity Actually Works
description: Electricity doesn't flow the way you think it does. The energy isn't in the electrons — it's in the electromagnetic fields.

title: Math's Fundamental Flaw
description: Not everything that is true can be proven. This discovery transformed infinity, challenged the foundations of mathematics, and led to the development of computers.

title: The Bizarre Behavior of Rotating Bodies
description: Spinning objects have strange instabilities known as the Dzhanibekov effect or tennis racket theorem.

title: Why No One Has Measured The Speed Of Light
description: Physics assumes the speed of light is the same in all directions, but no one has ever actually measured it one-way.

title: A Physics Prof Bet Me $10,000 I'm Wrong
description: I bet a UCLA physics professor $10,000 that a wind-powered vehicle can go directly downwind faster than the wind.

title: Parallel Worlds Probably Exist. Here's Why
description: The Many Worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics suggests every quantum measurement splits the universe.

title: Why It Was Almost Impossible to Make the Blue LED
description: Blue LEDs required decades of research and the persistence of one engineer who defied his employer's orders.

title: The Illusion Only Some People Can See
description: An optical illusion that some people see as motion while others see it as completely static — and what this reveals about the brain.

title: How Were the Pyramids Built?
description: New evidence suggests the ancient Egyptians used a surprisingly simple technique involving water and sand to build the Great Pyramid.
